attributes.action: make it law that food manufactured in the UK must state  if it is not suitable for vegetarians
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Some food manufacturers are getting away with sneaking in animal derived material into their food products without stating it on the food labels. They do this by exploiting loop holes in food labelling requirements. Even the e-numbers included on labels are not sufficient for the average consumer. Wouldn't it be more helpful to (us) vegetarians if food labels clearly stated whether or not a vegetarian can/cannot consume the product?
